dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Bilirakis (for himself and Ms. Castor of Florida) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on Ways and Means, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned
Reported from the Committee on Energy and Commerce
The Committee on Ways and Means discharged; committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed

form.official-title: To amend title XI of the Social Security Act to increase civil money penalties and criminal fines for Federal health care program fraud and abuse, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Medicare Civil and Criminal Penalties Update Act.

section.header: Increased civil and criminal penalties and increased sentences for Federal health care program fraud and abuse

subsection.header: Increased civil money penalties and criminal fines

paragraph.text: Section 1128A of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1320a–7a) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a), in the matter following paragraph (10)—

clause.text: by striking $10,000 and inserting $20,000 each place it appears;
by striking $50,000 and inserting $100,000 each place it appears; and
in paragraph (1), in the flush text following subparagraph (B), by striking $2,000 and inserting $5,000;
in paragraph (2), by striking $2,000 and inserting $5,000; and
in paragraph (3)(A)(i), by striking $5,000 and inserting $10,000.

paragraph.text: Section 1128B of such Act (42 U.S.C. 1320a–7b) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a), in the matter following paragraph (6)—

clause.text: in paragraph (1), in the flush text following subparagraph (B), by striking $25,000 and inserting $100,000; and
in paragraph (2), in the flush text following subparagraph (B), by striking $25,000 and inserting $100,000;

subparagraph.text: in subsection (c), by striking $25,000 and inserting $100,000;
in subsection (d), in the flush text following paragraph (2), by striking $25,000 and inserting $100,000; and
in subsection (e), by striking $2,000 and inserting $4,000.

subsection.header: Increased sentences for felonies involving Federal health care program fraud and abuse

paragraph.text: Section 1128B(a) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1320a–7b(a)) is amended, in the matter following paragraph (6), by striking not more than five years or both, or (ii) and inserting not more than 10 years or both, or (ii).
Section 1128B(b) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 1320a–7b(b)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), in the flush text following subparagraph (B), by striking not more than five years and inserting not more than 10 years; and
in paragraph (2), in the flush text following subparagraph (B), by striking not more than five years and inserting not more than 10 years.

paragraph.header: False statement or representation with respect to conditions or operations of facilities
paragraph.text: Section 1128B(c) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 1320a–7b(c)) is amended by striking not more than five years and inserting not more than 10 years.
Section 1128B(d) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 1320a–7b(d)) is amended, in the flush text following paragraph (2), by striking not more than five years and inserting not more than 10 years.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to acts committed after the date of the enactment of this Act.

endorsement.action-desc: Reported from the Committee on Energy and Commerce
The Committee on Ways and Means discharged; committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
